metadata.title: CVE-2014-5439 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerabilities exists in Sniffitprior to 0.3.7 via a crafted configuration file that will bypassNon-eXecutable bit NX, stack smashing protector SSP, and address spacelayout randomization ASLR protection mechanisms, which could let amalicious user execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

sniffit - 0.3.7.beta-17+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sniffit package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.7.beta-17+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
